intro: Oenanthe rivularis, commonly known as the water dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Oenanthe rivularis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
